help_entry.name: readCharacterData
help_entry.succinct: Read a character matrix or set of character matrices
help_entry.description: This function reads the character data contained in Phylip, Fasta, or Nexus files. The function takes as input the path and name of a file (if the contents of only a single file is to be read) or the path to a directory (if all of the Phylip, Fasta, or Nexus files in a directory are to be read).

argument.arg_description: A string that contains the path to a file in Phylip, Fasta, or Nexus format or the path to a directory that may contain many files in those formats.

help_entry.details: The readCharacterData function uses the Nexus Class Library to read Nexus files. A file starting with '#NEXUS' or having the file ending '.nex' will be interpreted as a Nexus file. If the file does not meet any of these criteria, the content is read to determine whether it might be a Phylip or Fasta file. The function works both on individual files and on file directories. Multiple character or data blocks in a Nexus file will be returned as an array of character matrices. A directory may contain multiple data files in different format. The function will skip the files that do not appear to be Nexus, Phylip or Fasta files.
help_entry.value: The return value is a vector containing one or more character matrices.
